intro: Distictis lactiflora, commonly known as the milkweed plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its milky sap, which is a distinguishing feature. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and are pollinated by insects. The leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a hairy texture.
